Sequence Information.Peptide Name: IN1(designed based on indolicidin and ranalexin)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.26046345] Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=31.25μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 15442(MIC=31.25μg/ml), Acinetobacter baumanii ATCC 15308(MIC>250μg/ml), citrobacter spp(MIC>250μg/ml), Klebsiella pneumoniae(MIC>250μg/ml) ;Gram-positive bacteria:Streptococcus pneumoniae(30 clinical isolates)(MIC=31.25–62.5μg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=31.25μg/ml), Methicillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA)(MIC=31.25μg/ml), Enterococcus cloacae(MIC>250μg/ml),
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.26046345] The hemolytic activities of IN1 is 3.6% at 250μg/ml against human RBCs.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.26046345] The cell viability of NL-20 cell line is not affected (<10%) below 62.5 μg/ml. The cell viability of NL-20 is 37% and 17% at peptide concentrations of 125 and 250 μg/ml.The cell viability of WRL-68 cell line is not affected (<10%) bel
Sequence Information.Function: Exhibits antimicrobial activity against the Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial Activity of Novel Synthetic Peptides Derived from Indolicidin and Ranalexin against Streptococcus pneumoniae.
Literature.Author: Jindal HM, Le CF, Mohd Yusof MY, Velayuthan RD, Lee VS, Zain SM, Isa DM, Sekaran SD.
